revision.comment: Rescuing 2 sources and tagging 0 as dead.) #IABot (v2.0
revision.text:
{{More citations needed|date=May 2007}} {{Politics of Cape Verde}} [[Cape Verde]] follows a policy of [[neutrality (international relations)|nonalignment]] and seeks cooperative relations with all friendly states. [[Angola]], [[Brazil]], the [[People's Republic of China]], [[Cuba]], [[France]], [[Germany]], [[Portugal]], [[Senegal]], [[Russia]], [[South Korea]] and the [[United States]] maintain embassies in [[Praia]].
Cape Verde is actively interested in foreign affairs, especially in [[Africa]]. It has [[Bilateralism|bilateral relations]] with some [[Lusophone]] nations and holds membership in a number of international organizations. It also participates in most international conferences on economic and political issues.
{| class="wikitable sortable" style="width:100%; margin:auto;" |- ! style="width:15%;"| Country ! style="width:12%;"| Formal Relations Began !Notes |- valign="top" |{{flag|Andorra}}||<!--Date started-->30 June 2006||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on June 30, 2006.<ref>[http://www.mae.ad/en/bilateral-and-consular-affairs/bilateral-affairs]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Angola}}||<!--Date started-->December 1975||See [[Angola–Cape Verde relations]]
Cape Verde signed a friendship accord with Angola in December 1975, shortly after Angola gained its independence. Cape Verde and [[Guinea-Bissau]] served as stop-over points for [[Cuban troops]] on their way to Angola to fight [[UNITA]] rebels and [[South Africa]]n troops. [[Prime Minister of Cape Verde|Prime Minister]] [[Pedro Pires]] sent [[Revolutionary Armed Forces of the People|FARP]] soldiers to Angola where they served as the personal bodyguards of [[Angolan President]] [[José Eduardo dos Santos]].<ref name=b>{{cite book|last=Lobban|first=Richard|year=1995|title=Cape Verde:Crioulo Colony to Independent Nation|pages=111–112}}</ref> * Angola has an embassy in [[Praia]]. * Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Luanda]]. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Argentina}}||<!--Date started-->26 July 1975||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 26, 1975.<ref>[http://tratados.mrecic.gov.ar/tratado_ficha.php?id=4132]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Armenia}}||<!--Date started-->26 February 2007||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on 26 February 2007. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Australia}}||<!--Date started-->||
Australia and Cape Verde are represented to each other’s country through their respective embassies in Lisbon, Portugal.<ref>[http://dfat.gov.au/geo/cabo-verde/Pages/cabo-verde.aspx]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Brazil}}||<!--Date started-->1975||See [[Brazil–Cape Verde relations]]
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Brasília]]. * Brazil has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Canada}}||<!--Date started-->1976||
Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1976.<ref>[http://www.canadainternational.gc.ca/senegal/bilateral_relations_bilaterales/canada_cabo-verde.aspx?lang=eng]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|China}}||<!--Date started-->|| In January 2007, [[Manuel Inocêncio Sousa]], Minister of Infrastructure, Transports and Sea, acknowledged the [[People's Republic of China]]'s importance to Cape Verde stating:
"''China has been a friend of Cape Verde even before it gained independence from Portugal 30 years ago. Bilateral relations have been very good: in 2002, for example, the trade value between our two countries reached US $1.8 million, in Chinese exports of light industry products and miscellaneous goods.''" * Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Beijing]]. * China has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Croatia}}||<!--Date started-->19 August 1994||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on August 19, 1994.<ref>[http://www.mvep.hr/en/foreign-politics/bilateral-relations/date-of-recognition-and-establishment-of-diplomatic-relations/]</ref><ref>[http://www.mvep.hr/en/foreign-politics/bilateral-relations/overview-by-country/cape-verde,60.html]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Cuba}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Havana]]. * Cuba has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Cyprus}}||<!--Date started-->31 May 2000||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on May 31, 2000.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.olc.gov.cy/olc/olc.nsf/all/64F97A47A9EF9B3DC22575D70022AD2E/$file/List%20of%20Cape%20Verde.pdf?openelement |title=Archived copy |access-date=2018-01-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180117011907/http://www.olc.gov.cy/olc/olc.nsf/all/64F97A47A9EF9B3DC22575D70022AD2E/$file/List%20of%20Cape%20Verde.pdf?openelement |archive-date=2018-01-17 |url-status=dead }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Czech Republic}}||<!--Date started-->||
Czech Republic is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Lisbon, Portugal<ref>[https://www.mzv.cz/jnp/en/diplomatic_missions/czech_missions_abroad/index.html]</ref><ref>[https://www.mzv.cz/lisbon/pt/embaixada_e_consulados_honorarios/index.html]</ref> and an honorary consulate in [[Praia]]<ref>[https://www.mzv.cz/jnp/en/diplomatic_missions/czech_missions_abroad/cape_verde_consulado_honorario_de.html]</ref>. |- valign="top" |{{flag|France}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Paris]] and a consulate-general in [[Nice]]. * France has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Georgia}}||<!--Date started-->22 January 2010||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on January 22, 2010. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Guinea-Bissau}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[Cape Verde–Guinea Bissau relations]]
The Republic of Guinea-Bissau is about 900 km south-east of Cape Verde in coastal West Africa. Both were colonies of the [[Portuguese Empire]] and they campaigned together for independence with a plan for unification, but the countries separated after 1980.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ipri.pt/artigos/artigo.php?ida=104 |title=Widening trajectories: Guinea Bissau and Cape Verde since independence |first=Norrie |last=MacQueen |work=Relações Internacionais |date=February 1, 2006 |accessdate=October 29, 2015 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150423212017/http://www.ipri.pt/artigos/artigo.php?ida=104 |archivedate=April 23, 2015 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=NbJ8AQAAQBAJ|title=Historical Dictionary of the Republic of Guinea-Bissau|chapter=Cape Verde, Relations with|publisher=Scarecrow Press|last1=Mendy|first1=Peter Karibe|first2=Richard A.|last2=Lobban, Jr.|date=October 17, 2013|accessdate=October 29, 2015|isbn=}}</ref> * Cape Verde is accredited to Guinea Bissau from its embassy in Dakar, Senegal. * Guinea Bissau has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Hungary}}||<!--Date started-->||
Hungary is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Lisbon, Portugal<ref>[http://www.kormany.hu/en/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/missions ]</ref><ref>[https://lisszabon.mfa.gov.hu/eng]</ref> and an honorary consulate in Praia.<ref>[http://www.kormany.hu/en/ministry-of-foreign-affairs-and-trade/missions]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|India}}||<!--Date started-->||
After Cape Verde became a Portuguese colony in the 15th century, it became an important transit point for trade routes from Europe to India and Australia.<ref>{{cite web|title=Cabo Verde|url=http://dfat.gov.au/geo/cabo-verde/Pages/cabo-verde.aspx|website=Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade|accessdate=21 April 2017|language=en-us}}</ref> The Embassy of India in Dakar, Senegal is concurrently accredited to Cape Verde. Cape Verde maintains an Honorary Consulate General in New Delhi.<ref>{{cite web|title=Hony. Consulates in India|url=http://meaprotocol.nic.in/?a4Cape/Verde?New/Delhi|website=Protocol Division, Ministry of External Affairs|accessdate=21 April 2017|language=en}}</ref>
Foreign Minister Jose Brito was the first Cape Verdean minister to visit India in November 2009.<ref>{{cite web|title=Cape Verde is a natural partner for India:Shashi Tharoor|url=http://www.indiainfoline.com/article/news-sector-others/cape-verde-is-a-natural-partner-for-india-shashi-tharoor-113092901212_1.html|website=India Infoline|accessdate=21 April 2017|location=Mumbai}}</ref> Minister of State for Rural Development Sudarshan Bhagat visited Cape Verde in September 2015 as the Prime Minister's Special Envoy. Bhagat invited Cape Verde to send a delegation to attend the third India Africa Forum Summit. Foreign Minister Tolentini Araujo Jorge led the Cape Verdean delegation to participate in the Summit in New Delhi in October 2015.<ref name="MEA2016">{{cite web|title=India - Cabo Verde Relations|url=http://www.mea.gov.in/Portal/ForeignRelation/Cabo_Verde_DEC2016.pdf|website=Ministry of External Affairs (India)|accessdate=21 April 2017|date=December 2016}}</ref>
Bilateral trade between Cape Verde and India totaled US$4.20 million in 2014-15, declining by 40.72% from the previous fiscal. India exported $1.43 million worth of goods to Cape Verde, and imported $2.77 million. The main commodities exported from India to Cape Verde are drugs, pharmaceuticals, plastic and linoleum products, and man-made fibers.<ref name="MEA2016"/>
IBSA provided a grant to refurbish a healthcare Centre in Cape Verde. India provided a line of credit worth $5 million to establish a Technology Park in the country. India donated $50,000 in 2010 to help the Government of Cape Verde to fight dengue fever, and supplied computers for the Government's "A New World" programme in October 2012. Citizens of Cape Verde are eligible for scholarships under the [[Indian Technical and Economic Cooperation Programme]] and the [[Indian Council for Cultural Relations]].<ref name="MEA2016"/>
A small Indian community resides in Cape Verde.<ref name="MEA2016"/> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Indonesia}}||<!--Date started-->||
Indonesia is represented in Cape Verde by its embassy in [[Dakar]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.kemlu.go.id/dakar/en/Pages/Cape-Verde.aspx |title=Archived copy |access-date=2018-01-16 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180930042531/https://www.kemlu.go.id/dakar/en/Pages/Cape-Verde.aspx |archive-date=2018-09-30 |url-status=dead }}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Israel}}||<!--Date started-->July 1994||
Both countries established diplomatic relations in July 1994.<ref>[http://mfa.gov.il/MFA/AboutTheMinistry/Pages/Israel-s%20Diplomatic%20Missions%20Abroad.aspx]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Japan}}||<!--Date started-->11 July 1975||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 11, 1975.<ref>[http://www.mofa.go.jp/af/af1/cv/page22e_000242.html]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Latvia}}||<!--Date started-->21 October 1992||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on October 21, 1992.<ref>[http://www.mfa.gov.lv/en/policy/establishment-and-renewal-of-diplomatic-relations]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Lithuania}}||<!--Date started-->28 May 1992||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on May 28, 1992.<ref>[https://urm.lt/default/en/list-of-countries-with-which-lithuania-has-established-diplomatic-relations]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Malta}}||<!--Date started-->17 March 2016||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on March 17, 2016.<ref>[http://foreignaffairs.gov.mt/en/Government/Embassy%20Press%20Releases/Pages/Protocol-signed-establishing-diplomatic-relations-between-Malta-and-Cape-Verde.aspx]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Mexico}}||<!--Date started-->1976||
* Cape Verde is accredited to Mexico from its embassy in Washington, D.C., United States. * Mexico is accredited to Cape Verde from its Permanent Mission to the [[United Nations]] in [[New York City]].<ref>[https://directorio.sre.gob.mx/index.php/misiones-de-mexico-en-el-exterior/onu Permanent Mission of Mexico to the United Nations]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Mongolia}}||<!--Date started-->19 November 1975||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on November 19, 1975.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20110722215952/http://www.mfat.gov.mn/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=70&Itemid=83&lang=en]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Montenegro}}||<!--Date started-->||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on December 17, 2010.<ref>[http://www.mvp.gov.me/rubrike/bilateralni-odnosi/Tabela-priznanja-i-uspostavljanja-diplomatskih-odn]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Mozambique}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde is accredited to Mozambique from its embassy in Luanda, Angola and maintains an honorary consulate in [[Maputo]]. * Mozambique does not have an accreditation to Cape Verde. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Portugal}}||<!--Date started-->5 July 1975||See [[Cape Verde–Portugal relations]]
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Lisbon]]. * Portugal has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Russia}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Moscow]]. * Russia has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|São Tomé and Príncipe}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[São Tomé]]. * São Tomé and Príncipe has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Senegal}}||<!--Date started-->||
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Dakar]]. * Senegal has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Serbia}}||<!--Date started-->1975||
Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1975.<ref>[http://www.mfa.gov.rs/en/foreign-policy/bilateral-issues/96-bilateral-issues/12254-cape-verde]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|South Africa}}||<!--Date started-->4 April 1994||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on April 4, 1994.<ref>[http://www.dirco.gov.za/foreign/bilateral/capeverde.html]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|South Korea}}||<!--Date started-->3 October 1988||
Establishment of Diplomatic Relations between the Republic of Korea and Cape Verde is 3 October 1988. In 2011 Bilateral Trade were Exports $1,140,792 (Machineries, Automobile, Optical Instruments) Imports: $65,166.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.mofa.go.kr/ENG/countries/middleeast/countries/20070804/1_24498.jsp?menu=m_30_50|title=Countries and Regions > Middle East and Africa > List of the Countries|last=Korea|first=Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Republic of|work=Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Republic of Korea|access-date=2017-07-19|language=ko}}</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Spain}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[Cape Verde–Spain relations]]
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Madrid]]. * Spain has an embassy in Praia. |- valign="top" |{{flag|Switzerland}}||<!--Date started-->1980||
Both countries established diplomatic relations in 1980.<ref>[https://www.eda.admin.ch/eda/en/home/laender-reise-information/kap_verde/schweiz-kap-verde.html]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Turkey}}||<!--Date started-->||
Turkey is represented in Cape Verde by its embassy in Dakar and an honorary consulate in Praia.<ref>[http://www.mfa.gov.tr/relations-between-turkey-and-cape-verde.en.mfa]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|Ukraine}}||<!--Date started-->||
Ukraine is represented in Cape-Verde by its embassy in Dakar, Senegal.<ref>[http://mfa.gov.ua/en/about-mfa/abroad/embassies/99]</ref> |- valign="top" |{{flag|United States}}||<!--Date started-->||See [[Cape Verde-United States relations]]
The United States provided emergency humanitarian aid and economic assistance to Cape Verde in the period immediately following Cape Verde's independence, as well as after natural disasters, including a [[hurricane]] that struck the island of Brava in 1982, and after a severe [[volcanic eruption]] on Fogo in 1995. Cape Verde also is eligible for trade benefits under the [[African Growth and Opportunity Act]] (AGOA), and has signed an Open Skies agreement to facilitate air travel safety and expansion. On July 4, 2005, Cape Verde became the third country to sign a compact with the U.S. Government-funded [[Millennium Challenge Corporation]] (MCC); the five-year assistance package is worth over $110 million in addressing rural economic expansion, [[infrastructure]] development, and development of the credit sector.
* Cape Verde has an embassy in [[Washington, D.C.]] and a consulate in [[Boston]]. * United States has an embassy in Praia. {{StateDept |url=https://2009-2017.state.gov/r/pa/ei/bgn/2835.htm}} |- valign="top" |{{flag|Vietnam}}||<!--Date started-->8 July 1975||
Both countries established diplomatic relations on July 8, 1975.<ref>[http://www.mofa.gov.vn/en/cn_vakv/]</ref> |}
==Multilateral Relations==
